update.description:
A generic flash light plugin: **FlashLightPlugin**. It accesses <light> elements under <link> and makes them to flash and dim based on the given parameters \(duration and interval\). It has TurnOn/Off functions so a plugin inherited from this class can activate flash lights without touching ~/light/modify topic, like turning on/off a bike headlight.

A demo world file: **flash\_light\_plugin\_demo.world**. A model has two links \(cylinder and box\) and each link has two lights attached on it. Based on the parameters, the lights on the cylinder keep blinking while the ones on the box are either turned off or staying constant.

Testing code:** INTEGRATION\_flash\_light\_plugin**. It is to verify that the plugin publishes correct messages to control the lights. It listens to ~/light/modify topic and measures the actual duration/interval time and the last update time of each light. It passes if the error is within 0.01 sec.
update.title: Flash light plugin

update.description:
A generic flash light plugin: **FlashLightPlugin**. It accesses <light> elements under <link> and makes them to flash and dim based on the given parameters \(duration and interval\). It has TurnOn/Off functions so a plugin inherited from this class can activate flash lights without touching ~/light/modify topic, like turning on/off a bike headlight.

A demo world file: **flash\_light\_plugin\_demo.world**. A model has two links \(cylinder and box\) and each link has two lights attached on it. Based on the parameters, the lights on the cylinder keep blinking while the ones on the box are either turned off or staying constant.

Testing code:** INTEGRATION\_flash\_light\_plugin**. It is to verify that the plugin publishes correct messages to control the lights. It listens to ~/light/modify topic and measures the actual duration/interval time and the last update time of each light. It passes if the error is within 0.01 sec.
update.title: Flash light plugin

content.raw:
I see... How about making them members of `FlashLightPluginPrivate`? This way, all settings would share the same node and publisher.

I think it would be best not to use them as singletons because we need to clean them up in the destructor, for example, if the model which contains this plugin is deleted.
content.html:
I see... How about making them members of FlashLightPluginPrivate? This way, all settings would share the same node and publisher.

I think it would be best not to use them as singletons because we need to clean them up in the destructor, for example, if the model which contains this plugin is deleted.

content.raw:
I wanted to use them like singletons. They are members of the class FlashLightSettings. There could be more than one instance of the class, and each one independently accesses them to publish its message. So the first instance will initializes them and the following instances share them.

But yeah, the plugin itself should have the node and pass the publisher to each instance of FlashLightSettings. I will remove them so that they don’t have static variables.
content.html:
I wanted to use them like singletons. They are members of the class FlashLightSettings. There could be more than one instance of the class, and each one independently accesses them to publish its message. So the first instance will initializes them and the following instances share them.

But yeah, the plugin itself should have the node and pass the publisher to each instance of FlashLightSettings. I will remove them so that they don’t have static variables.

content.raw: `ServerFixture` should already have created and initialized a node, so you could just use `this->node->Subscribe...` directly
content.html: ServerFixture should already have created and initialized a node, so you could just use this->node->Subscribe... directly

content.raw: Document return value here and in all other functions
content.html: Document return value here and in all other functions

content.raw: You could use `override` here, and for the documentation, just say `// Documentation inherited` so doxygen pulls the documentation from `ModelPlugin`
content.html: You could use override here, and for the documentation, just say // Documentation inherited so doxygen pulls the documentation from ModelPlugin

content.raw: Also here, set found to true
content.html: Also here, set found to true

content.raw: Set found to true?
content.html: Set found to true?

content.raw: It would also be good to document the special case when an empty link name is passed
content.html: It would also be good to document the special case when an empty link name is passed

content.raw: We're trying to use `nullptr` instead of `NULL`, mind changing it?
content.html: We're trying to use nullptr instead of NULL, mind changing it?

content.raw: Consider breaking the loop when a match is found
content.html: Consider breaking the loop when a match is found

content.raw: Are they really static? I think these 2 lines can be removed?
content.html: Are they really static? I think these 2 lines can be removed?

content.raw: Missing parameter and return documentation
content.html: Missing parameter and return documentation

content.raw: Please document all the parameters
content.html: Please document all the parameters

content.raw: Thanks for the PR, @tidota ! I'm starting to take a look at this PR now, but meanwhile, could you take a look at [Gazebo's style guide](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=contrib_code&cat=development#Style) and make some adjustments? For example, variable names should use `camelCase` rather than `not_camel_case`, `public` should be listed above `private`, etc.
content.html: Thanks for the PR, @tidota ! I'm starting to take a look at this PR now, but meanwhile, could you take a look at Gazebo's style guide and make some adjustments? For example, variable names should use camelCase rather than not_camel_case, public should be listed above private, etc.

update.description:
A generic flash light plugin: **FlashLightPlugin**. It accesses <light> elements under <link> and makes them to flash and dim based on the given parameters \(duration and interval\). It has TurnOn/Off functions so a plugin inherited from this class can activate flash lights without touching ~/light/modify topic, like turning on/off a bike headlight.

A demo world file: **flash\_light\_plugin\_demo.world**. A model has two links \(cylinder and box\) and each link has two lights attached on it. Based on the parameters, the lights on the cylinder keep blinking while the ones on the box are either turned off or staying constant.

Testing code:** INTEGRATION\_flash\_light\_plugin**. It is to verify that the plugin publishes correct messages to control the lights. It listens to ~/light/modify topic and measures the actual duration/interval time and the last update time of each light. It passes if the error is within 0.01 sec.
